metadata.title: CVE-2022-42852 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixedin Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2 and iPadOS15.7.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciouslycrafted web content may result in the disclosure of process memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
